p.em: What happens if you tear your anterior cruciate ligament (ACL), which runs through the knee?

multiple_choice.choice: Your knee will have less stability.
You will no longer be able to move your lower leg.

response.feedback: Correct. Ligaments provide stability to joints.
Incorrect. A ligament is not a bone; bones break, but ligaments tear.
Incorrect. You will still be able to move your lower leg, although it may be more difficult or even painful.
Incorrect. ACL injuries are common in athletes and often require surgical repair.

part.hint: With a partial tear of the ACL, people can continue with normal activities as long as they are careful.

p.em: Articular cartilage is found on the ends of bones. Its function(s) is/are to (select one of two correct answers):

multiple_choice.choice: Help connect muscles to the ends of the bone.
Protect the underlying bone from frictional damage.

response.feedback: This is one of the functions of cartilage, which is softer than bone and therefore adds cushiony support.
Incorrect. You are close, but this is mostly a function of ligaments.
Incorrect. This is the job of tendons.
This is one of the functions of cartilage, as hard bones can create friction between them if they are in direct contact.

part.hint: In arthritis, the articular cartilage is damaged or destroyed, leading to painful and limited joint movement.
